content.1: So I returned, and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold the tears of
content.2: Wherefore I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive.
content.4: Again, I considered all travail, and every right work, that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This
content.5: The fool foldeth his hands together, and eateth his own flesh.
content.7: Then I returned, and I saw vanity under the sun.
content.10: For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him
content.11: Again, if two lie together, then they have heat: but how can one be warm
content.12: And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.
content.14: For out of prison he cometh to reign; whereas also
content.15: I considered all the living which walk under the sun, with the second child that shall stand up in his stead.
